articles.title: Hawaii receives newest COVID-19 treatment, but it hasn’t been distributed to hospitals yet - Hawaii News Now
articles.description: The treatment is for patients 12 and up who have mild to moderate symptoms but are at risk for severe COVID-19 symptoms.
articles.content:
HONOLULU, Hawaii (HawaiiNewsNow) - Hawaii has received 80 vials of a new COVID-19 antibody treatment, but hurdles with distributing it mean no hospitals have their hands on it yet.
